title: Gargoyle's Stoneplate isn't much of a worth item
body:
It's kinda hard to trigger its passive due to short range. The second frustrating thing about this... When one of enemies die during teamfight u will lose bonus armor/resist.
So can we increase its range to more appropriate standart or at least make dead bodies of enemy champions to be considered as a viable trigger for armor/resist passive.
Right this is is just way way way worse version of pre 7.9 guardian angel.

or riot could just stop with the fucking health scalings. they arent good for the game. i already see another season 5 on the horizon where tanks out damage ADCs

Cho'gath's health scalings are literally the only health scaling true damage ability that make stoneplate a problem. Any other %health damage scaling ability would get reduced by **60%**. 

Health scaling is more or less fine and isn't even that common. Cho'gath's true damage interaction with stoneplate is the only issue of health scaling abilities out scaling ADCs. 

The only tank I know of with a health scaling damage ability is Braum right now. And I don't stoneplate is going to make him out damage an adc. 

Who else is there?
Gnar's Hop, Jarvans Shield, Galios shield, Maokai's sap magic (which is pretty insane currently), actually im not going to name all of them because there are waaaaaay too many to name.

Gnar: fair enough. I forgot him. 

J4: not a tank. 

Galio shield: this is a defensive scaling. I thought you were against offensive health scaling, not defensive. 

Maokai: again, this is a defensive scaling. 

And the offensive ones don't matter because their damage would be reduced by **60%** with the stoneplate active. Making the added health not scale as well with their abilities in the 4 second time frame.
im against all HP scalings. always have been. they are fucking stupid

So even a defensive stat scaling for a defensive ability is dumb?

What?  Are people supposed to just build AP if they want better shields?  Cause getting defensive stats for offensive stats is just fine and dandy. 

Health scalings are fine. They belong in the game.

> J4: not a tank. 

How? He doesn't have good offensive scaling. His combo involves attempting to knock up as many enemies as possible to initiate, then hold targets in place with R. He slows with his shield, and his damage is pretty "meh" for anything that isn't a tank.

Riot categorizes him as a diver.

Well, I just found what you're talking about-the forum post where they say what each champion is?

Which directly contradicts what the client actually shows; that he's a tank. Divers fall under the fighter category, looks like they have a mix up.

Though to be honest I've seen enough odd labeling (GP support??), I don't put much trust in what they call someone-instead relying on what they actually do.
Client hasn't updated with the new subclasses.

he can be played as one, but it's not the most effective way of playing him. he's better off as a fighter leaning more towards the tanky side as opposed to xin who tends to build more damage.

building him full tank with the extra 1 or 2 defense items aren't going to make him last that much longer in a fight while effectively wasting his 1.2 AD and 1.5 AD ratios on his Q and R. They will at least grab a BC usually, then maybe a titanic. the only time you'd want to build full tank is if you are supporting, which is a bit troll already, and cannot afford even that 1 slot for damage because you are getting {{item:2303}}, or if you are behind.

To be fair, I never said you shouldn't build any AD on him-I was saying he was classified as a tank and I didn't see why he should be a diver.

It's apparently been too long since I last played him-I was thinking his ratios were .8/1.0, not 1.2/1.5. Maybe I'm thinking of someone else. Which does change my outlook on him some, because that's a pretty hefty difference in damage.

the way he plays is pretty diver-like. *ideally* you'd want to land a 3-5 man knockup followed by a R that lumps them together for your team AoE but otherwise, it's usually easier to land your entire load on a squishy to take down 3/4 of their hp, while isolating them for a 1v1, except for the fact that half the champion roster can naturally escape his R with an ability and all of them can with flash.
You ever seen any J4 ever? There is a reason the community nicknames him Jumpscare Jarvan. He does plenty of damage.

> [{quoted}](name=NiceTryVi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wkKw6zqe,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000010002,timestamp=2017-05-13T03:04:42.318+0000)
>
> You ever seen any J4 ever? There is a reason the community nicknames him Jumpscare Jarvan. He does plenty of damage.

You mean the build that is effectively full damage, and would blow up pretty fast in a fight, making it so he can't really act as a diver like I said earlier?

I've played plenty of Jarvan myself. I'm not claiming to be a pro or anything, but I used to play him a lot. Any champions damage can become high when you build all AD. Even AP's without any sort of attack speed, AD steroid, etc. become scary when you build full AD.

Use the same build on say, Xin Zhao, and its much scarier. J4 doesn't innately have alot of damage, and if you build him that way you'll be fairly squishy-while not getting the scaling of other champions.

Hence why I'm saying he's not really a diver.
Except for the fact that all the damage items he builds also give him some tank stats, and he can do AoE with CC as well? Jarvan is not nearly as squishy as you are trying to claim.

What does J4 bring to a team?

Passive is damage
Q is damage and armor shred
W is a shield and minor slow
E gives attack speed, and damage, can be combo-ed with q to be a gapcloser and knock up
R AoE damage + totally-passable terrain 

Aside from W, he doesn't have any skills that would resemble a tank.  Virtually all of his power budget is spent on AoE damage, good AD ratios, AoE armor shred and an attack speed aura.  As such, he falls much closer in line to a form of melee DPS, specifically the diver sub-group. 

Let me put it another way if it still doesn't make sense.

Tell me, how does J4 keep his teammates from dying?  He kills the people hurting them, or he can't do anything.  He has no way to redirect damage, to absorb damage, to give (defensive) utility to his teammates, nor does he have a reliable lockdown or strong AoE hard CCs.  In short, he doesn't have the tools to be a tank, he's just not made of tissue paper.

i was a J4 main for the entirety of S3 (or 4, I forgot), and he is very effective at keeping his team from dying if you know what you're doing. He peels very well if you are dedicated to it (as in, not diving the enemy but staying by your carry). W slow can be chained with an easy point-blank EQ knockup which is pretty much impossible to miss, followed by the R if they burn their gap closers to continue their dive. 

That being said, diving their priority target probably is more worth it especially since your own ADC would likely have a support on duty already for peels.
